medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reported bilateral, lateral back pain overlying her ribs during a follow-up for anorexia nervosa. She has chronic abdominal pain that has worsened over the last week, described as excruciating and burning, primarily epigastric with radiation to the back and esophagus. She has been mentally and physically exhausted, has not eaten in 3 days, and experiences ongoing abdominal pain. The pain is not clearly associated with eating, and exacerbating or alleviating factors are unspecified.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Anorexia nervosa, Bulimia, Polysubstance abuse (including cocaine), Recurrent nasal infections, Depression, Generalized Anxiety Disorder, Hypokalemia requiring admission.
medical_history.family_history: Grandmother with stroke and myocardial infarction. No history of pancreatic or gallbladder disease.
medical_history.social_history: Patient admits to drinking an unspecified number of drinks per day. Social history details beyond this are not specified.
